title: Quality data, not the model
description: The next time you hear about a new frontier in artificial intelligence, don’t ask who built the model. Ask who trained it, and where the data came from.
content: AI might be the next trillion-dollar industry, but it’s quietly approaching a massive bottleneck. While everyone is racing to build bigger and more powerful models, a looming problem is going largely unaddressed: we might run out of usable training d... [4042 chars]

title: AI could one day replace tutors, but its reliability still lags
description: Artificial intelligence has become an integral part of many people's everyday lives. Large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT, Gemini or Copilot write letters and term papers for them, give tips for excursions on holiday or answer questions on every conceivable topic.

title: OpenAI expects business to burn $115 billion through 2029
description: OPENAI has sharply raised its projected cash burn through 2029 to $115 billion as it ramps up spending to power the artificial intelligence behind its popular ChatGPT chatbot, The Information reported on Friday.
content:
OPENAI has sharply raised its projected cash burn through 2029 to $115 billion as it ramps up spending to power the artificial intelligence behind its popular ChatGPT chatbot, The Information reported on Friday.
The new forecast is $80 billion higher... [1350 chars]

title: Apple sued by authors over use of books in AI training
description: TECHNOLOGY giant Apple was accused by authors in a lawsuit on Friday of illegally using their copyrighted books to help train its artificial intelligence systems, part of an expanding legal fight over protections for intellectual property in the AI era.
content: TECHNOLOGY giant Apple was accused by authors in a lawsuit on Friday of illegally using their copyrighted books to help train its artificial intelligence systems, part of an expanding legal fight over protections for intellectual property in the AI e... [1624 chars]

title: Laptops with AI power lead back-to-school choices
description: AS students return to classrooms this school year, laptops are once again proving to be a critical tool for learning, productivity, and creative work. With artificial intelligence now shaping study habits, performance requirements have shifted, making AI-ready machines the new standard.

title: PH kicks off 2025 Development Policy Research Month on AI in governance
description: THE Philippines cannot rely on new technology alone to thrive in the age of artificial intelligence. Strong governance policies must come first — this was the central call of the 2025 Development Policy Research Month (DPRM), which opened on Sept. 1 with a push for AI rules that reflect national realities.
content: THE Philippines cannot rely on new technology alone to thrive in the age of artificial intelligence. Strong governance policies must come first — this was the central call of the 2025 Development Policy Research Month (DPRM), which opened on Sept. 1 ... [1162 chars]

title: Apple faces lawsuit over alleged use of pirated books for AI training
description: Two authors have filed a lawsuit against Apple, accusing the company of infringing on their copyright by using their books to train its artificial intelligence model without their consent.

title: The human cost of Artificial Intelligence
description: Technology has brought people closer together, but with the rise of AI, online gaming, and viral challenges, new vulnerabilities have emerged. Chatbots, AI companions, and gaming platforms have been linked to mental health issues and even deaths. title: The human cost of Artificial Intelligence
description: Digital platforms becoming more companion-like, but sans regulation, can have tragic consequences.

title: AI lung cancer risk model validated in predominantly Black population at hospital
description: A new study presented at the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer 2025 World Conference on Lung Cancer (WCLC) validates the use of Sybil, a deep learning artificial intelligence model, for predicting future lung cancer risk in a predominantly Black population.
